data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3243054,"name":"Samuel","username":"SBG","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-10-19T23:08:07.126Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHey everyone, Our team is working on upgrading our pit majorly and part of that includes upgrading our toolboxes to include storage above. I’ve designed it to have 2 ft of workspace and then above is about a 20in tall rectangle thats 85 x 18.5 inches. We’re considering downsizing the length to 37 in. because we might not need that much storage but we aren’t a 100% on how much we’ll downsize. Has anyone else done anything like this. I think mostly we’d like to know is how to keep it stable but any other tips are very helpful as well. Our toolbox that’ll be below it its top is 37 x 18.5 in. We’d like to be able to remove the cabinets when needed so that it can fit into our trailer. We are very thankful for any advice.
